Post code, Postal code... --> | postal_code = | area_code = | website = | footnotes = [[List of neighbourhoods in Saskatoon]] }} [[File:Saskatoon 056.jpg|thumb|McNab Park residential area prior to demolition]] '''Airport Business Area''' is an [[industrial park]] located in the [[North Industrial SDA, Saskatoon|North Industrial SDA]] Suburban Development Area of [[Saskatoon]], [[Saskatchewan]]. Industrial parks are usually located close to [[transport]] facilities, especially where [[intermodal freight transport|more than one transport modalities]] coincide. The Idylwyld Drive North, [[Saskatchewan Highway 11|Sk Hwy 11 Louis Riel Trail]], and [[Saskatchewan Highway 12|Sk Hwy 12]] concurrency are all accessed directly from the Airport Business Area. The [[Saskatoon John G. Diefenbaker International Airport]] is north of the Airport Business Area. Circle Drive marks the southern boundary, with access to [[Saskatchewan Highway 14|SK Hwy 14]] and [[Saskatchewan Highway 16|Sk Hwy 16, the Yellowhead Trans Canada]].
==Geography== [[File:Saskatoon 050.jpg|thumb|Hudson Bay Slough, Idylwyld Drive Parclo Interchange in distance. Airport Business Area, Saskatoon, Saskatchewan]] The land was annexed from the [[rural municipality]] of [[Corman Park No. 344, Saskatchewan|Corman Park]] between 1965-1969. The Airport Business subdivision is several major trucking routes. The Idylwyld Drive North, [[Saskatchewan Highway 11|Sk Hwy 11 Louis Riel Trail]] to [[Prince Albert, Saskatchewan|Prince Albert]] via [[Warman, Saskatchewan|Warman]], and [[Saskatchewan Highway 12|Sk Hwy 12]] to [[Blaine Lake]] via [[Martensville, Saskatchewan|Martensville]] concurrency mark the eastern boundary. [[Circle Drive]] marks the southern boundary, with access to [[Saskatchewan Highway 14|SK Hwy 14]] and [[Saskatchewan Highway 16|Sk Hwy 16, the Yellowhead Trans Canada]]. It is a main thoroughfare through the city connecting [[Regina, Saskatchewan|Regina]], [[Saskatoon]] and [[Prince Albert, Saskatchewan]]. It also connects west Saskatoon with the bedroom communities of [[Warman, Saskatchewan|Warman]] and [[Martensville, Saskatchewan|Martensville]].
The area includes the western end of the Hudson Bay Slough, a water feature that used to dominate the northern end of Saskatoon. Much of the slough has been drained for development, but a large remnant has been preserved east of Avenue C and north of 45th Street as part of RCAF Memorial Park.
===McNab Park - Airport Industrial - Larkhaven===
Until the early 2000s, the Airport Business Area consisted of three separate districts:
'''McNab Park''', a small [[residential]] community that served as [[Barracks|military housing]] until the 1960s when Saskatoon's airport ceased to double as an [[air base]], and continued to be used for low-cost housing<ref>[http://www.saskatoon.ca/org/development/resources/business_profile_newsletters/newsletter_summer2001.pdf BUSINESS PROFILE] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071201065856/http://www.saskatoon.ca/org/development/resources/business_profile_newsletters/newsletter_summer2001.pdf |date=2007-12-01 }} URL accessed January 27, 2007</ref> until the early 2010s;
'''Airport Industrial''', a business/[[Commercial district|commercial park]] that developed east of the airport and east of McNab Park beginning in the 1970s;
'''Lark Haven''' (alternately spelled Larkhaven), another business park that developed south of McNab Park in the early 1980s.<ref>[http://www.valuation-net.com/affiliates/brunsdon/articles/office2001.pdf 2000 to 2001 Saskatoon Office Study] URL accessed January 27, 2007</ref>
The Airport Business Area also includes a newly plotted, but as of 2017 undeveloped business park west of the Lark Haven section and east of [[Hampton Village, Saskatoon|Hampton Village]], which will also include a major commercial area.
An oddity to the area is Lark Place. This street has been shown on maps as a street that crossed at the intersection of [[Circle Drive]] and Airport Drive since the mid-1980s. Despite it still appearing on maps, Lark Place is considered a [[paper street]] with no plans for it to be developed in the near future.
McNab Park was decommissioned as a residential area in the early 2010s and all structures were demolished by early 2012 (its school was closed and demolished in the early 1980s); it is now being redeveloped as a business park (including several hotels), with a new street layout and new street names allocated. It remains to be seen if the longstanding street names in the area (Jeremy, Maney, etc.) are reassigned to other communities.
==Economy== [[File:AirportBusinessArea.jpg|thumb|left|Saskatoon Airport Business Area.]] The Airport Business Area park is a mix of commercial and industrial concerns south east of the [[Saskatoon John G. Diefenbaker International Airport]]. Areva NC (formerly named COGEMA resources), R.C.A.F. Memorial Park, Saskatoon Machine Works, Shaw Communications, Global Television are businesses based in the airport business park. Saskatoon Inn, Heritage Inn, Travelodge, Mainstay, Courtyard Marriot, Hampton Inn & Suites by Hilton, Sandman Hotel and Country Inn and Suites are next to the airport for the travelling business person. Saskatoon Hyundai and Auto Clearing are auto dealerships which make their home base in the Airport Business Area.
In the Airport Business Area subdivision are 3374 full-time employees and 841 part-time employees.<ref>{{cite web | title = Final Report 2005 | url = http://www.saskatoon.ca/org/transit/strategicplan/FinalReport2005.pdf | accessdate = 2008-05-12}} {{Dead link|date=October 2010|bot=H3llBot}}</ref>
==Future plans== [[File:McNabPark.jpg|thumb|McNab Park Airport Business Area Saskatoon Sk]] The airport business area is a part of the local area plans of the City of Saskatoon infrastructure development. Some of the upcoming plans are to structure Airport Drive as a "Gateway to Saskatoon", and the residential component at McNab Park was removed prior to 2011, with the area now being revamped for light industrial and business park uses. Other plans include renaming the area to Airport Business Area from Airport Industrial Area, and incorporating the proposed Hampton Industrial area within Airport Business Area. Development of the area west of Airport Drive and northwest of Circle Drive and reserving the Larkhaven Park formation as a park space are also in the plans.<ref>[http://www.city.saskatoon.sk.ca/org/city_planning/local_area_plans/plans_being_implemented/airport_industrial_presentation.pdf Airport Industrial Local Area Plan Airport Industrial Local Area Plan] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070929110444/http://www.city.saskatoon.sk.ca/org/city_planning/local_area_plans/plans_being_implemented/airport_industrial_presentation.pdf |date=2007-09-29 }} URL accessed January 27, 2007</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Summary Notes_134719046 |work=Local Area Plan Airport Business Area |publisher=City of Saskatoon |url=http://www.city.saskatoon.sk.ca/org/city_planning/local_area_plans/plans_being_implemented/lap_recommendations/airport_industrial_implementation_summary.pdf |accessdate=2008-05-13 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071026033506/http://www.city.saskatoon.sk.ca/org/city_planning/local_area_plans/plans_being_implemented/lap_recommendations/airport_industrial_implementation_summary.pdf |archivedate=October 26, 2007 }}</ref> However plans as of late 2017 call for Aerogreen Road to be extended south from Cynthia Street, which will bisect the park; the same plans also show a major commercial development earmarked for the intersection of Claypool Drive and McClocklin Road.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.saskatoon.ca/sites/default/files/documents/community-services/planning-development/mapping/wall-maps/index_nhoods_map.pdf|title= City of Saskatoon Neighbourhood Boundaries Map|author=City of Saskatoon |date= Nov 20, 2017 |website= City of Saskatoon|publisher= |access-date= Dec 3, 2017|quote=}}</ref>

{{Expand Russian|topic=bio|Егиазарян, Ашот Геворкович|date=April 2013}} {{Infobox criminal | name = Ashot Egiazaryan | image_name = | image_size = 180px | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1965|7|24}} | birth_place = [[Moscow]], [[Russia]] | occupation = Politician | spouse = | children = | parents = }}
'''Ashot Gevorkovich Egiazaryan''' (Russian: Ашот Геворкович Егиазарян; Armenian: Աշոտ Գեւորգովիչ Էկիազարյան), born July 24, 1965 in [[Moscow]], [[Russia]] is fugitive from political persecution (accounts vary), former Russian politician, and businessman.
==Career==
===Banking=== In 1988, Egiazaryan graduated from the Economics Faculty of Moscow State University with a Ph.D. in economics, and subsequently began a career in banking.
In 1993, Egiazaryan established and became the Chairman of the Moscow National Bank (MNB). By 1995, MNB had become one of the largest banks in Russia, housing accounts of the Administration of Moscow region, The Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation, Russian State Arms Export Company, The Russian Space Agency and the General Prosecutor’s Office.
In 1996, Egiazaryan was appointed Deputy Chairman of the Board of Directors of “Unikombank” JSCB, a position he held from June 1996 to May 1998.
In 1999, Egiazaryan provided testimony in the criminal case regarding the embezzlement of $130 million from accounts held at MNB. The embezzled funds belonged to state-owned Rosvooruzheniye Weaponry Company. The investigation found that MNB used forged documents to withdraw the state funds. The stolen money was then moved through the MNB-controlled Unikom bank.
MNB’s banking license was revoked in 1998, but no criminal charges were brought against Egiazaryan.
===Politics=== In 1999, Egiazaryan became a member of the State Duma and deputy chairman of the Committee on Budget and Taxes.
In October 2010, the State Duma’s Credentials and Ethics Commission recommended stripping Egiazaryan of parliamentary immunity at the request of the Investigative Committee.
On November 3, 2010, the State Duma followed through with a request by Russian Prosecutor General Yury Chaika and officially stripped Egiazaryan of his immunity. A total of 352 lawmakers of the Duma voted in favor of this action, with 39 deputies, all members of the Liberal Democratic Party, opposing the motion and five members abstained from the vote.<ref>“In the Deputy Signs of Fraud Were Found.” [http://www.kommersant.ru/doc.aspx?DocsID=1528001&NodesID=6 Kommersant.ru]. October 23, 2010. (Russian language)</ref>
==Criminal Indictment== In August 2010, Europark investor Vitaly Smagin filed a lawsuit against Egiazaryan, accusing him of pledging Smagin’s stake in the Europark shopping mall in western Moscow to Deutsche Bank as collateral on an $87.5M loan. The $87.5M loan was then used to secure a 20% interest in the Moskva Hotel project.<ref>{{cite web|author=250 |url=http://www.wek.ru/articles/politic/76017.shtml |title=Жириновскому не простят Егиазаряна |publisher=Wek.ru |date=2010-08-26 |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref>
In September 2010, after the commencement of a criminal investigation into the $87.5M fraud, Egiazaryan filed a claim in a Cyprus court complaining that a group of Russian politicians, and businessmen, including [[Suleyman Kerimov]], conspired to take over Egiazaryan’s share in the multi-billiondollar Moskva Hotel project.<ref>{{cite web|last=Belton |first=Catherine |url=http://www.ft.com/intl/cms/s/0/ef30542c-c67b-11df-8a9f-00144feab49a.html#ixzz16Cm02qTO |title=Russian tycoon’s assets frozen |publisher=FT.com |date=2010-09-22 |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref> On September 15, 2010, a Cyprus court granted an injunctive freeze on Suleyman Kerimov’s assets.<ref>{{cite web|last=Orphanides |first=Stelios |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2010-11-17/kerimov-set-to-challenge-asset-freeze-in-dec-14-court-hearing.html |title=Kerimov Set to Challenge Asset Freeze in Dec. 14 Court Hearing |publisher=Bloomberg |date=2010-11-17 |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref> The case was later dismissed on February 15, 2011 and the district court of Nicosia in Cyprus lifted the injunction on Kerimov’s assets. The court stated that Egiazaryan had failed to disclose essential facts in the original filing for the injunction and that the alleged conspiracy happened 15 months before the filing of the original complaint.<ref>{{cite web|last=Orphanides |first=Stelios |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-02-15/cyprus-court-lifts-freeze-on-russia-billionaire-kerimov-s-assets.html |title=Cyprus Court Lifts Freeze on Uralkali, Polyus Stock |publisher=Bloomberg |date=2011-02-15 |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref>
In October 2010 the State Duma’s Credentials and Ethics Commission recommended stripping Egiazaryan of parliamentary immunity at the request of the Investigative Committee, based on accusations that Egiazaryan embezzled $87 million for his share of the Hotel Moskva project.<ref>“Parliament member sued for embezzlement.” Russian Financial Control Monitor. August 24, 2010.</ref>
On November 3, 2010, the State Duma officially stripped Egiazaryan of his immunity.<ref>“Duma Deputy May Lose Immunity.” [http://www.themoscowtimes.com/news/article/duma-deputy-may-lose-immunity/420806.html Moscow Times]. October 22, 2010.</ref>
In November 2010, investigators raided Egiazaryan’s offices at the Dayev Plaza and also conducted searches at Egiazaryan’s residences in Moscow. The search was later extended to the offices of the Europark shopping mall, of which Egiazaryan was a part owner.<ref>“Investigators searched the office deputy from the LDPR Ashot Yeghiazaryan.” ''[https://translate.google.com/translate?hl=en&sl=ru&u=http://www.yerkramas.org/2010/11/08/sledovateli-obyskali-kabinet-deputata-ot-ldpr-ashota-egiazaryana/&ei=bKbZTNPFIcb_lgeUw83LCQ&sa=X&oi=translate&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CBUQ7gEwAA&prev=/search%3Fq%3Dhttp://www.yerkramas.org/2010/11/08/sledovateli-obyskali-kabinet-deputata-ot-ldpr-ashota-egiazaryana/%26hl%3Den%26client%3Dfirefox-a%26hs%3Ddzu%26rls%3Dorg.mozilla:en-US:official%26prmd%3Div Yerkarmas]''. November 8, 2010. (Russian language); “Yegiazaryan Office Searched.” ''[http://www.themoscowtimes.com/news/article/yegiazaryan-office-searched/422050.html Moscow Times]''. November 9, 2010.</ref><ref>"Investigators Search the Places of Residence or Stay in Moscow of Deputy Ashot Egiazaryan." ''[http://www.itar-tass.com/txt/level2.html?NewsID=15734829&PageNum=0 Itar-tass]{{dead link|date=October 2016 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}'' (Russian language). 1/12/2010.</ref>
On December 17, 2010, the Russian Authorities seized three land plots belonging to Egiazaryan.<ref>{{cite web|publisher=The Moscow Times|url=http://www.themoscowtimes.com/news/article/yegiazaryans-land-seized/427023.html|title=Yegiazaryan's Land Seized|date=17 December 2010|accessdate=23 January 2011| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20101222133520/http://themoscowtimes.com/news/article/yegiazaryans-land-seized/427023.html| archivedate= 22 December 2010 <!--DASHBot-->| deadurl= no}}</ref> One plot is located in Barvikha, and the other two in Zhukovka. Egiazaryan’s Duma office was also searched and investigators seized paperwork related to the case against him.<ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite web|author=22/4/2013 8:31 |url=http://en.rian.ru/russia/20110309/162927233.htm |title=Main news of March 9 | World | RIA Novosti |publisher=En.rian.ru |date= |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref>
In January 2011, the Basmanny district court of Moscow indicted Egiazaryan on charges of large scale fraud. The court also attached Egiazaryan’s assets to be used to compensate Vitaly Smagin and Europark for the $87.5M that was embezzled.<ref>{{cite web|author= |url=http://www.sledcom.ru/news/40240.html?sphrase_id=169159 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130706102316/http://www.sledcom.ru/news/40240.html?sphrase_id=169159 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=2013-07-06 |title=В рамках уголовного дела в отношении Ашота Егиазаряна наложен арест на денежные средства и ценные бумаги |publisher=Sledcom.ru |date= |accessdate=2013-04-22 }}</ref>
As a result of the court ruling, the lower house of parliament in Russia gave approval on March 9, 2011 for Egiazaryan’s arrest on charges of large-scale fraud.<ref name="autogenerated1"/>
==Arrival in the United States== After being indicted for fraud in Russia, Egiazaryan fled to the United States, claiming that he feared for his life and that the fraud allegations against him were politically motivated.<ref name="jewishjournal1">{{cite web|author=peter zalmayev |url=http://www.jewishjournal.com/opinion/article/hiding_in_beverly_hills_20110309 |title=Hiding in Beverly Hills | Opinion |publisher=Jewish Journal |date=2011-03-09 |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref>
[[Peter Zalmayev]], director of the Eurasia Democracy Initiative (EDI), stated, “Egiazaryan claims he is fleeing persecution, but the real reason appears to be that he is fleeing prosecution. His lawyers are reportedly seeking political asylum for their client.”<ref name="jewishjournal1"/>
Egiazaryan later sued Zalmayev for defamation and Zalmayev countersued for infringement of his speech utilizing the anti-[[SLAPP|Strategic Lawsuits Against Public Participation]] laws of New York State. Egiazaryan’s case was dismissed, but Zalmayev’s case continues.<ref>{{cite web|author=leagle.com |url=http://www.leagle.com/xmlResult.aspx?xmldoc=In%20FDCO%2020111208B70.xml&docbase=CsLwAr3-2007-Curr |title=EGIAZARYAN v. ZALMAYEV - December 6, 2011 |publisher=Leagle.com |date= |accessdate=2013-04-22}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist|30em}}

'''Mohamad "Bob" Hasan''' (born 1931) is an [[Indonesia]]n businessman, former Minister of Trade and Industry, and friend of former [[president of Indonesia]], [[Suharto]].
==Early life== Hasan, was born in [[Semarang]], [[Central Java]], Indonesia in February 1931. He is a legally adopted son of [[Gatot Soebroto|Gatot Subroto]], a general in the [[Indonesian Army]], who commanded then-Colonel Suharto in the 1950s, and through whom Hasan met Suharto.
==Business career== After Suharto replaced Subroto as commander of the Army's Diponegoro Division, Hasan worked with Suharto to develop a wide range of side businesses, controlled by the military, that provided much of the funding for the Division as well as extra income for its officers.<ref name="barr1998">Barr, Christopher M (1998). [http://cip.cornell.edu/Dienst/UI/1.0/Summarize/seap.indo/1106953918 Bob Hasan, the rise of Apkindo, and the shifting dynamics of control in Indonesia's timber sector]. ''Indonesia'' 65:1-36.</ref>
After Suharto took the presidency in 1966, he initiated a massive expansion of Indonesian commercial logging, especially in the islands outside of [[Java]]. In the 1970s Hasan served as the required Indonesian "partner" for foreign companies wanting to harvest timber in Indonesia, working most notably with the [[United States]] corporation [[Georgia Pacific]], and also established a number of joint ventures between his and government-owned companies. In 1981 the government banned the export of unmilled timber, leading to many foreign companies selling their Indonesian operations to domestic owners interested in establishing processing operations; Hasan, already a major shareholder in Georgia Pacific's Indonesia operation, became its sole owner when the company left Indonesia in 1983.<ref name="barr1998"/> Starting from timber, he expanded his business interests into financial, insurance, automotive, and other industries, primarily through his Kalimanis [[holding company]].<ref name="saragosa">Saragosa, Manuel (1997). Indonesian tycoon plays influential role. ''Financial Times'' February 13. p 6.</ref> Hasan's Kalimanis group was reported to control over 2 million hectares (7,700 square miles) of prime concessions in [[Kalimantan]].<ref name="Economist1997"/>
Hasan was also Chairman of the Indonesian Wood Panel Association (Apkindo) Under Hasan, Apkindo was given complete control of plywood pricing, marketing, and exports. Apkindo helped Indonesia gain about three-quarters of the worldwide plywood export market by the early 1990s, sometimes using techniques described by observers as "[[predatory pricing]]". Hasan personally profited from his chairmanship both by supporting business he owned, and through control of the fees paid to the organization by other members.<ref name="barr1998"/>
Hasan ran PT Nusantara Ampera Bakti (Nusamba) which is 80%-owned by foundations controlled by Suharto.<ref name="Economist1997">{{cite web|title=Indonesia’s Uncle Bob (Mar 27, 1997)|url=http://www.economist.com/node/367251?_ga=1.41763362.1244557049.1469992653|publisher=The economist|accessdate=31 July 2016}}</ref><ref name=WSJ021697>{{cite news|last1=Borsuk|first1=Richard|title=Freeport Beats Out Canadians To Develop Busang Gold Mine|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB856111694777478500|accessdate=31 July 2016|work=The Wall Street Journal|date=Feb 16, 1997}}</ref>
Hasan was said to become the mediator in disputes between Suharto's six children, after the death of Suharto's wife.<ref name="Economist1997"/> He was reported to orchestrate the deal of settling shareholder dispute of the Busang gold deposit found by [[Bre-X Minerals]] in Kalimantan.<ref name="Economist1997"/><ref name=WSJ021697/>
==Indonesian cabinet ministry== Suharto appointed Hasan Minister of Trade and Industry in 1998, making him the only Indonesian of Chinese descent ever to join Suharto's cabinet. His appointment was criticised by some foreign financial analysts as evidence that Suharto was not interested in substantial fiscal changes after the [[East Asian financial crisis|Asian financial crisis]] began in 1997.<ref>Porter, Barry (1998). Suharto cronies dominate new financial team. ''South China Morning Post'' March 15.</ref> As a result of [[International Monetary Fund]] (IMF) requirements during the crisis, Apkindo was closed down in 1998.<ref name="cotton1999">Cotton, James (1999). The "haze" over Southeast Asia: challenging the ASEAN mode of regional engagement. ''Pacific Affairs'' 72(3):331-351.</ref>
==Corruption convictions and imprisonment== Hasan was frequently the subject of allegations of corruption as a result of his business dealings and control of much of Indonesian industry; after Suharto stepped down in 1998, a series of court judgements found evidence of crimes. He was fined 50 billion [[Indonesian rupiah|rupiah]] ([[United States dollar|US$]]7 million) as a result of a lawsuit filed by several youth organisations, alleging that Hasan had ordered the burning of forests in [[Sumatra]].<ref name="cotton1999"/> In February 2001, a court unanimously convicted him of causing a US$244 million loss to the Indonesian government through a fraudulent forest-mapping project in Java in the early 1990s, leading to imprisonment. He was imprisoned at [[Cipinang prison]] and then at the more secure [[Nusa Kambangan]], an island off the coast of south-central Java, until his release on [[parole]] in February 2004.<ref>Donnan, Shawn (2004). Jailed ex-tycoon Hasan is released early in Indonesia. ''Financial Times'' February 23. p 2.</ref> Hasan was the first and among the most prominent of former Suharto associates convicted of fraud and corruption after Suharto resigned in May 1998.
Hasan was a member of the [[International Olympic Committee]] from 1994 to 2004, when the IOC expelled him due to his corruption conviction. The IOC was criticised by the Indonesian government in 2000 after the IOC argued that Hasan should be allowed to attend the [[2000 Olympic Games]] in Sydney, Australia despite his being under arrest at the time.<ref>Bita, Natasha (2000). IOC tries to get its own out of jail. ''The Australian''. September 13.</ref>

| type = bureau | seal = US Department of State official seal.svg | seal_width = 120px | seal_caption = Seal of the United States Department of State | logo = | formed = | preceding1 = | preceding2 = | jurisdiction = [[Executive branch of the United States]] | employees = 458 ({{as of|2013}})<ref>{{cite web|title=Inspection of the Bureau of International Information Programs|url=https://oig.state.gov/system/files/211193.pdf|publisher=[[Office of the Inspector General of the Department of State]]|date=May 2013|accessdate=November 21, 2015}}</ref> | budget = $55 million<ref>{{cite web|title=Bureau of International Information Programs|url=http://www.allgov.com/departments/department-of-state/bureau-of-international-information-programs?agencyid=7188|publisher=AllGov|accessdate=March 22, 2016}}</ref> | chief1_name = [[Jonathan Henick]] | chief1_position = [[Coordinator for International Information Programs]] {{small|(Acting)}} | chief2_name = | chief2_position = | chief3_name = [[Nicole Chulick]] | chief3_position = Deputy Coordinator for Products | chief4_name = [[Tom Cochran (politician)|Tom Cochran]] | chief4_position = Deputy Coordinator for Platforms | chief5_name = [[Tom Smitham]] | chief5_position = Deputy Coordinator for Programs | chief6_name = | chief6_position = | chief7_name = | chief7_position = | chief8_name = | chief8_position = | chief9_name = | chief9_position = | parent_department = [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]] | website = [https://www.state.gov/r/iip/ Official Website] }} The [[United States Department of State|U.S. Department of State]]'s '''Bureau of International Information Programs''' ('''IIP''') supports the department's public diplomacy efforts by providing and supporting the places, content, and infrastructure needed for sustained conversations with foreign audiences. IIP is one of three bureaus that report to the Undersecretary for Public Diplomacy and Public Affairs. The [[Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs]] and the [[Bureau of Public Affairs]] are the sister bureaus.
== History ==
When the Foreign Affairs and Restructuring Act abolished the [[United States Information Agency]] (USIA) on October 1, 1999, USIA's broadcasting functions were moved to the newly created [[Broadcasting Board of Governors]] (BBG), and its non-broadcasting information functions were given to the newly created Under Secretary of State for Public Diplomacy and Public Affairs. The Bureau of International Information Programs was created out of this restructuring.
== Mission and purpose ==
According to the bureau's page on the Department of State website, IIP "provides and supports the places, content, and infrastructure needed for sustained conversations with foreign audiences to build America's reputation abroad".<ref>{{cite web|title=Bureau of International Information Programs|url=https://www.state.gov/r/iip/index.htm|publisher=U.S. Department of State}}</ref>
Physical and virtual places include over 700 American Spaces around the world,<ref>{{cite web|title=American Spaces|url=https://www.state.gov/r/iip/amerspaces/|publisher=U.S. Department of State}}</ref> as well as a large social media community that numbers over 12 million followers. Content includes publications, video, and U.S. expert speakers, who engage foreign audiences both in person and through virtual programs. IIP manages the infrastructure for all embassy and consulate websites, translations of public remarks by the President and Secretary, and maintains internal websites with resources for use by public diplomacy officers for overseas programs.
==Role and responsibility==
The Bureau of International Information Programs provides public diplomacy materials and support in three primary areas:
; Digital IIP operates the department's embassy and consulate websites, which attract more than 150 million unique visitors per year (http://usembassy.gov) in over 60 languages. IIP also supports embassy social media efforts with theme-based Facebook pages and Twitter sites in six languages, reaching more than 12 million fans and followers.
IIP also operates an interactive web-chat platform that links foreign audiences to U.S. subject matter experts, opinion-makers, community leaders, and government officials in more than 800 programs each year. In September 2014, the bureau launched a new social sharing platform [https://share.america.gov ShareAmerica] to distribute public diplomacy content that is interesting, policy-relevant, and visually appealing.
; American Spaces American Spaces exemplify the United States' commitment to a core tenet of democracy: the citizen's right to free access to information. Hosting more than 16 million visits each year, American Spaces support public diplomacy by creating a place for in-person engagement with foreign audiences. Over 700 Spaces are hosted in embassies, schools, libraries, and other partner institutions in 169 countries. They provide information about United States' policy, culture, and values as well as study in the United States. They also support English language learning and activities for alumni of international visitor programs.
; Public Diplomacy (PD) Content IIP creates and curates content that provides context and information on U.S. foreign policy topics in a variety of formats ranging from video to print publications to audio books, reaching more than one billion people a year. Much of this content, along with transcripts of the Secretary's and President's speeches, is available to embassies in multiple languages. IIP also produces more than 125 video products each year and recruits more than 650 speakers annually, including Supreme Court justices, renowned authors, innovators, scholars, entrepreneurs, journalists, and sports figures who connect directly with more than 160,000 people in local markets via in-country and virtual events.
; Analytics IIP has an advanced analytics capacity to measure output, campaign performance, perform audience analysis and track over 2,000 Department of State social media properties.
== See also == * [[Public diplomacy]] * [[United States Information Agency]]

{{no footnotes|date=February 2015}} '''Buyer credit''' is a short term [[Credit (finance)|credit]] available to an [[Importer|importer (buyer)]] from overseas lenders such as [[bank]]s and other [[financial institution]] for goods they are importing. The overseas banks usually lend the importer (buyer) based on the [[letter of comfort]] (a bank guarantee) issued by the importer's bank. For this service the importer's bank or buyer's credit consultant charges a fee called an arrangement fee.
Buyer's credit helps local importers gain access to cheaper foreign funds that may be closer to [[London Interbank Offered Rate|LIBOR]] rates as against local sources of funding which are more costly.
The duration of buyer's credit may vary from country to country, as per the local regulations. For example, in India, buyer's credit can be availed for one year in case the import is for tradeable goods and for three years if the import is for capital goods.
== Benefits to importer == Buyer's credit has several advantages for the importer. The exporter gets paid on due date; whereas importer gets extended date for making an import payment as per the cash flows. The importer can deal with exporter on sight basis, negotiate a better discount and use the buyers credit route to avail financing. The funding currency can be depending on the choice of the customer and availability of LIBOR rates in the exchange market. The importer can use this financing for any form of payment mode, such as: open account, collections, or LCs.
== Steps involved == # The customer requests the Buyer's Credit Arranger to arrange the credit before the due date of the bill # Arrange to request overseas bank branches to provide a buyer's credit offer letter in the name of the importer. Best rate of interest is quoted to the importer # Overseas bank to fund Importer's bank [[Nostro and vostro accounts|Nostro account]] for the required amount # Importer's bank to make import bill payment by utilizing the amount credited (if the borrowing currency is different from the currency of Imports then a cross currency contract is utilized to effect the import payment) # Importer's bank will recover the required amount from the importer and remit the same to overseas bank on due date. # It helps importer in working capital management.
== Cost involved == Interest cost is charged by overseas bank as a financing cost.
== Risk involved == Buyer's credit is associated with [[currency risk]]. Thus, [[Hedge (finance)|Hedging]] may be required as foreign currency is involved, making Buyer's Credit risky at times.
== Indian regulatory framework == Banks can provide buyer’s credit up to US$20 million (US$ 2 crore) per import transactions for a maximum maturity period of one year from date of shipment. In case of import of capital goods, banks can approve buyer’s credits up to $20 million per transaction with a maturity period of up to three years. No rollover beyond that period is permitted.
As per RBI directives dated 11.07.13, at the time of availment of trade credit, the period of trade credit should be linked to the operating cycle and trade transaction. AD banks need to ensure that these instructions are strictly complied with.
RBI has issued directions under Sec 10(4) and Sec 11(1) of the [[Foreign Exchange Management Act]], 1999, stating that authorized dealers may approve proposals received (in Form ECB) for short-term credit for financing—by way of either suppliers' credit or buyers' credit—of import of goods into India, based on uniform criteria. Credit is to be extended for a period of less than three years; amount of credit should not exceed $20 million, per import transaction; the `all-in-cost' per annum, payable for the credit is not to exceed 6 months LIBOR + 350 basis points for credit up to one year, and LIBOR + 125 basis points for credits for periods beyond one year but less than three years, for the currency of credit.
All applications for short-term credit exceeding $20 million for any import transaction are to be forwarded to the Chief General Manager, Exchange Control Department, [[Reserve Bank of India]], Central Office, External Commercial Borrowing (ECB) Division, Mumbai. Each credit has to be given `a unique identification number' by authorised dealers and the number so allotted should be quoted in all references. The International Banking Division of the authorised dealer is required to furnish the details of approvals granted by all its branches, during the month, in Form ECB-ST to the RBI, so as to reach not later than 5th of the following month. (Circular AP (DIR Series) No 24 dated September 27, 2002.
As per RBI Master circular on External Commercial Borrowing and Trade Finance 1 July 2011, the all-in cost ceiling for interest is now six month L + 200 {{Not a typo|bps}}(bps is Basis Points . A unit that is equal to 1/100th of 1%) for buyer's credit arrange for tenure up to three years. All cost ceiling includes arranger fee, upfront fee, management fee, handling and processing charges, out-of-pocket and legal expenses, if any.
The above ceiling got revised on 15/11/2011 to 6 Month Libor + 350 {{Not a typo|bps}} and got further extended on 30/03/2012 till 30/09/2012. From 01-10-2012 Maximum cap of 6 Month Libor + 350 bsp has been extended till further review.

'''CECOSESOLA''' ('''Central de las cooperativas de Lara''', '''Cooperatives of Social Services of Lara State''') is a hierarchy-free, solidary association of [[cooperatives]] in [[Venezuela]], with emphasis on cultivation and distribution of food and health care.<ref name=Maheshvarananda>{{cite web | url=https://venezuelanalysis.com/analysis/11034 | title=The Silent Success Of Cooperatives In The Bolivarian Revolution | publisher=[[Venezuelanalysis.com]] | date=November 21, 2014 | accessdate=July 19, 2017 | author=[[Dada Maheshvarananda]]}}</ref>
==History ==
The umbrella organization of cooperatives for social services in the [[Lara, Venezuela|state of Lara]] was founded in late in 1967. The first project of CECOSESOLA was a [[funeral home]]. It is now the largest in the region. The Institute operates its own [[coffin]] production.{{citation needed|date=August 2013}}
About fifty-based organizations with a total of 20,000 members (employees and users) are connected to the network. 1,200 Cooperative fashionistas work as "full-time" (trabajadores asociados) at CECOSESOLA. They get their livelihood directly from the total composite.<ref>"CECOSESOLA - On the Way", published by Die Buchmacherei, Berlin 2012 - Preface pp. 10/11</ref> They pay a weekly amount which is mentioned in the definition of [[wage labor]] "advance" (anticipo). The height is about twice the [[government]]-set [[minimum wage]]. This advance is based on people's requirements, so it is not the same for everyone. Those with children, for example, get more. In 2010, the turnover of the company amounted to 430 million Bolivares - around 100 million U.S. dollars.
===Projects===
* [[Barquisimeto]]: The organization operates three weekly markets, where every week 55,000 families – about a quarter of the [[urban area|urban]] population – provide them with [[fruits]], [[vegetables]] and [[foods]]. 450 tonnes of fruit and vegetables are sold weekly. The prices are on average 30 percent lower than those of privately operated markets. In addition, there is a shop for home appliances and furniture, where members can buy the products with installment payments without the usual high [[interest rates]].{{citation needed|date=August 2013}}
In the six projects of 190,000 [[health care]] treatments are performed per year. In 2009, the newly built health center was inaugurated in CICS. Here, alternative treatments such as [[acupuncture]] and [[massages]] are offered, but also [[surgical procedures]] and [[laboratory]] and [[X-ray]] examinations. The prices are 60 percent below those of private [[hospitals]]. For members of the cooperatives certain treatments are free.
The cooperative also includes farms: Twelve organizations in the states of Lara and Trujillo with over 200 small farms (2-3 hectares) supply the markets. In some, companies will try to replace [[agrochemicals]] with [[biological crop protection]]. Small production cooperatives produce foods that are sold in the markets - [[bread]], whole grain [[pasta]], cereals, [[tomato]] sauce, herbs, spices, [[honey]], fruit pulp etc. There is also a [[credit union]] and other financing and a Solidarity Fund.
==How does CECOSESOLA work?==
There is a high turnout of customers whose needs are not always discussed with them outside. Some of the customers are also involved in the cooperatives.
Inside the most striking feature is the absence of [[hierarchical]] positions. "All members can always get involved at all levels with the same rights. [[Consensus decision-making|Decisions in consensus]] and met again for discussion, if someone declares his non-acceptance in hindsight, was independent of whether the person involved in the decision or absent. In 2011, there were about 3,000 of the weekly meetings in individual and cooperative projects instead, and 300 cross-meetings."<ref>"CECOSESOLA - On the Way", published by Die Buchmacherei, Berlin 2012 - Preface p. 11</ref>
There is no governing body, no managing director and no supervision. You trying to make sure that the meetings are not a substitute for, the management or the manager. Each person or group to take responsibility for decisions that must be made in everyday life. consensus means for the members otherwise than unanimity. For the unanimity all members of a group or organization must be present. This corresponds to a vote in which all are in favor. A consensus decision is when they 'corresponds to, We, that is the criteria that you share in this moment -. Whether this decision was made by a person, a group or an informal gathering this kind, to make decisions, can obviously lead to chaos and missteps that may attract large economic losses. But all economic losses are by far compensated by the flexibility and dynamism that results in the organization, in that we free ourselves from the cultural [[shackles]] that restrict all our capacities and creative potential."<ref>"CECOSESOLA - On the Way", published by Die Buchmacherei, Berlin 2012, S.127/128, translation of a brochure of CECOSESOLA from 2009: "Hacia un colectivo de cerebro reuniones ... a espacios de encuentro?"</ref>
CECOSESOLA trying to take the place of [[power (social and political)|power]] and enforcement of personal interests in an opposite process. Dismantle hierarchies, making information accessible to all, build trust relationships and to establish its own identity on the collective power of [[solidarity]]. The experience of CECOSESOLA can explain different concepts:
:The productive force "cooperation" leads to increased efficiency. :The way of cooperation and cohesion increased motivation of employees. :The construction of network structures based on trust and cooperation supports the long-term survival of cooperatives.
Here, the forms that people interact with each other like here in relationship, beyond the sphere of work and production. Perhaps it is here rather a different way of life that needs no justification for efficiency criteria. "When we succeed, the self-organization of living with respect for others and the Other, we will do by and by this momentum to our own, and our behavior will be consistent with the process of life. This opens us the possibility to go beyond the dutiful ecological behavior that will get only from a utilitarian nature, which is at the service of man. We have the opportunity to be ecologically from scratch, since the nature then some of us will not be Separated: We are all natural Maybe we are just before opting for a form of life.. A choice that requires us to overcome the hierarchical relationship of power over the others that are part of our cultural heritage. An election in which it is clear that the takeover may be no alternative but to change the world ..... "<ref>"CECOSESOLA - On the Way", published by Die Buchmacherei, Berlin, 2012, p 104, translation from a brochure of CECOSESOLA from 2007: "Construyendo aqui y ahora que el mundo queremos"</ref>
==References== {{one source|date=July 2013}} {{Reflist}}

'''Cover your ass''' (British: '''arse'''), abbreviated '''CYA''', is activity done by an individual to protect himself or herself from possible subsequent criticism, legal penalties, or other repercussions, usually in a work-related or bureaucratic context. In one sense, it may be rightful steps to protect oneself properly while in a difficult situation, such as what steps to take to protect oneself after being fired.<ref>{{cite news |first=Korin |last=Miller |date=February 1, 2012 |work=[[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]] |url= http://www.cosmopolitan.com/career/advice/a3784/what-to-do-after-getting-laid-off-013112/ |title=Do This Immediately After Getting Laid Off |access-date=August 26, 2014 |quote=If you're handed a pink slip, ... make these moves to cover your butt ....}}</ref> But, in a different sense, according to ''[[The New York Times]]''{{'}} language expert [[William Safire]], it describes "the bureaucratic technique of averting future accusations of policy error or wrongdoing by deflecting responsibility in advance".<ref name=twsSafire/> It often involves diffusing responsibility for one's actions as a form of insurance against possible future negative repercussions.<ref name=twsSafire/> It can denote a type of institutional risk-averse mentality which works against accountability and responsibility, often characterized by excessive paperwork and documentation,<ref>{{cite news |first=Caitlin |last=Flanagan |date=November 1, 2007 |work=[[The Atlantic]] |url= https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2007/11/no-girlfriend-of-mine/306329/2/ |title=No Girlfriend of Mine |access-date=August 26, 2014 |quote=...cover-your-ass devotion to documentation and paperwork ....}}</ref> which can be harmful to the institution's overall effectiveness.<ref name=twsAtlantic/> The activity, sometimes seen as instinctive,<ref>{{cite news |first=Megan |last=McArdle |date=April 10, 2009 |work=The Atlantic |url= https://www.theatlantic.com/business/archive/2009/04/the-heroes-of-financial-fraud/12989/ |title=The Heroes of Financial Fraud |access-date=August 26, 2014 |quote=The instinct to CYA is a normal human emotion ....}}</ref> is generally unnecessary towards accomplishing the goals of the organization, but helpful to protect a particular individual's career within it, and it can be seen as a type of institutional corruption working against individual initiative.<ref>{{cite book |title=A Culture of Corruption: Changing an Australian Police Service |editor-first=David |editor-last=Dixon |publisher=Hawkins Press |date=1999 |url= https://books.google.com/books?id=MPihGaHK8jwC&pg=PA110&lpg=PA110&dq=(%22cover+your+ass%22)+OR+%22cover+your+butt%22+OR+%22cover+your+rear+end%22)+corruption&source=bl&ots=c_E2qdi9tF&sig=80SH7v54r3UuJ_cuThfGKlwsr40&hl=en&sa=X&ei=hPD8U-XFPIOgyASdwYGoAg&ved=0CCUQ6AEwAQ#v=onepage&q=(%22cover%20your%20ass%22)%20OR%20%22cover%20your%20butt%22%20OR%20%22cover%20your%20rear%20end%22)%20corruption&f=false |via=Google Books |chapter=A Culture of Corruption |access-date=August 26, 2014 |quote=This 'cover your ass' perspective pervades all of patrol work ... bureaucratic paranoia ... not take the initiative on the street ....}}</ref>
==Usage== The phrase ''cover your ass'' is generally viewed as a [[Vulgarity|vulgar]] term, often replaced by the less-vulgar sounding initials ''CYA''<ref name=twsSafire/> Safire identified ''CYA'' as a [[synecdoche]], in the same sense that the word "ass" had come to reference the whole person.<ref name=twsSafire>{{cite news |first=William |last=Safire |author-link=William Safire |date=August 18, 1987 |work=The New York Times |url= https://www.nytimes.com/1987/08/16/magazine/on-language-glossary-of-a-scandal.html |title=On Language: Glossary of a Scandal |access-date=August 26, 2014 |pages=163–164 |quote=[A] new sense has evolved that uses the word for the posterior as a synecdoche for the whole person ... the initials today are an anachronism ...}}</ref> The word "ass" in the phrase is often replaced with more polite versions or other [[euphemism]]s, such as "cover your actions", "cover your rear end", or "cover your butt", according to Safire.<ref name=twsSafire2>{{cite news |first=William |last=Safire |date=October 30, 1994 |work=The New York Times |url= https://www.nytimes.com/1994/10/30/magazine/on-language-on-the-edge.html |title=On Language: On the Edge |access-date=August 26, 2014 |quote=... the choice of 'cover your rear end' to define C.Y.A. by Senators ...}}</ref> The "cover your butt" variant has been used in various ways, such as by Minnesota health authorities urging citizens to undergo preventive [[Colonoscopy|colorectal exams]], as a way to "cover" themselves medically from possible future cancer.<ref>{{cite news |first=Carol |last=Kuruvilla |work=New York Daily News |date=March 22, 2013 |url= http://www.nydailynews.com/life-style/health/minnesota-takes-aim-colon-cancer-cheeky-new-ad-campaign-article-1.1296786 |title=Minnesota takes aim at colon cancer with cheeky new ad campaign: March is National Colorectal Cancer Awareness Month. Commuters in the Twin Cities metro area are getting daily reminders of why they need to get tested}}</ref> In banking, officers tasked with making sure the bank follows proper regulatory procedures, called [[Chief compliance officer|compliance officer]]s, may realize that certain dubious transactions, such as [[money laundering]] and [[terrorist financing]], will occur regardless of any regulatory restrictions;<ref>{{cite news |work=[[The Economist]] |url= http://economist.com/displaystory.cfm?story_id=5053373 |title=Financing terrorism: Looking in the wrong places |date=October 20, 2005}}</ref> still, to protect themselves and their banks against possible future sanctions, they may engage in CYA activity such as issuing unnecessary memos, obfuscating documents or conducting transactions discreetly, as ways to absolve themselves from possible future liability. The term is widely used in [[journalism]]. Safire explained how the term is used in [[bureaucracy]]:<ref>{{cite book |first=William |last=Safire |title=Safire's Political Dictionary |publisher=Oxford University Press |date=2008 |url= https://books.google.com/books?id=c4UoX6-Sv1AC&pg=PA164&lpg=PA164&dq=%22CYA%22+%22william+safire%22&source=bl&ots=V2wn_vtyFq&sig=4jJUXANwOshQQfUMqkVRS4UJ1Vg&hl=en&sa=X&ei=-3f8U8qkFtO4ogThw4HYCQ&ved=0CC8Q6AEwAg#v=onepage&q=%22CYA%22%20%22william%20safire%22&f=false |chapter=C.Y.A. |access-date=August 26, 2014 |page=164 |via=Google Books}}</ref>
{{Quote|A bureaucrat adept at ''C.Y.A.'' (a) likes to employ passive constructions (see ''[[mistakes were made]]''), (b) follows up a meeting or phone call with a self-serving ''memcon''—"[[memorandum of conversation]]", (c) routes memos to and through as many other bureaucrats as possible, thereby spreading the risk of future criticism, and (d) "papers the file" with memoranda sometimes supporting and sometimes contradicting his or her position.}}
Because these practices are so routine, a genuine warning can be mistaken for CYA behavior, causing a [[Type I and type II errors#Type II error|type II error]] or [[False positives and false negatives#False negative error|false-negative error]], with disastrous results. For example, in the summer preceding the [[September 11 attacks|attacks of 9/11]], U.S. president [[George W. Bush]] was briefed on a now-famous August 6, 2001, memo titled ''[[Bin Ladin Determined To Strike in US]]''. Bush's response to the briefer was reportedly: "All right. You've covered your ass, now."<ref>{{cite news |first=Barton |last=Gellman |date=June 20, 2006 |work=[[The Washington Post]] |url= https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2006/06/19/AR2006061901211.html |title=The Shadow War, In a Surprising New Light |access-date=November 5, 2014}}</ref>
In another example, before the launch of the United States spaceship Challenger which ended tragically with the [[Space Shuttle Challenger disaster]], the final launch approval by rocket maker [[Morton Thiokol]] contained the phrase "information on this page was prepared to support an oral presentation and cannot be considered complete without the oral discussion"; this notice was later described as a "CYA notice" by information design specialist [[Edward Tufte]].<ref>{{cite book |first=Edward R. |last=Tufte |author-link=Edward R. Tufte |title=Visual Explanations |publisher=Graphics Press |date=1997 |pages=26–53}}</ref> In print, it can have the form of a [[disclaimer]]; for example, ''[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]]'' magazine suggested that the [[Executive Office of the President of the United States|White House]] used the phrase "It is important not to read too much into any one monthly report" as a disclaimer on reports, and this was described as a CYA activity.<ref>{{cite web |first=David |last=Weigel |date=September 6, 2012 |work=[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]] |url= http://www.slate.com/blogs/weigel/2012/07/06/the_white_house_uses_the_exact_same_cya_sentence_in_every_jobs_report.html |title=The White House Uses the Exact Same CYA Sentence in Every Jobs Report}}</ref> The term has been applied in the medical profession to describe doctors who prescribe unnecessary medical tests for patients, to protect themselves against possible future lawsuits.<ref>{{cite news |first=Megan |last=McArdle |date=February 8, 2010 |work=The Atlantic |url= https://www.theatlantic.com/business/archive/2010/02/the-reality-of-health-care-plans/35533/ |title=The Reality of Health Care Plans |access-date=August 26, 2014 |quote=... we could eliminate a hell of a lot of unnecessary day to day expenses ... visits of convenience and CYA tests for diseases there's no indication the patient has ....}}</ref> The term has been used to describe a cultural tendency which works against accountability and risk-taking, such as in a war effort when generals engage in much ''cover your ass'' activity which avoids taking real responsibility.<ref name=twsAtlantic>{{cite news |first=Thomas E. |last=Ricks |date=October 24, 2012 |work=The Atlantic |url= https://www.theatlantic.com/magazine/archive/2012/11/general-failure/309148/ |title=General Failure |access-date=August 26, 2014 |quote=... appropriate risk-taking diminished (the art of combat pursuit was almost lost in Vietnam), and a 'cover your ass' mentality took hold ....}}</ref>
==See also== *[[Due diligence]] *[[Mistakes were made]] *[[Plausible deniability]] *[[Principal–agent problem]]
==Footnotes== {{Reflist}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2011}} {{Infobox sportsperson | headercolor = | name = Dale Begg-Smith | country = {{AUS}} | sport = [[Freestyle skiing]] | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1985|1|18}}<ref name=vancouver2010>{{cite web|title=Dale Begg-Smith |url=http://vancouver2010.olympics.com.au/athlete/dale-begg-smith.html |website=vancouver2010.olympics.com.au |publisher=[[Australian Olympic Committee]] |accessdate=29 May 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150310224825/http://vancouver2010.olympics.com.au/athlete/dale-begg-smith.html |archivedate=10 March 2015 |df=dmy }}</ref> | birth_place = [[Vancouver]], [[British Columbia]], Canada<ref name=vancouver2010/> | death_date = | death_place = | height = 186 cm<ref name=vancouver2010/> | weight = 75 kg<ref name=vancouver2010/> | pb = | website = | titles = Greatest World Cup Champion of All Time | worldcup = 4 World Cup Season tital | medaltemplates = {{MedalSport | Men's [[Freestyle skiing at the Winter Olympics|freestyle skiing]]}} {{MedalCountry|{{AUS}}}} {{MedalOlympic}} {{MedalGold| [[2006 Winter Olympics|2006 Turin]] | [[Freestyle skiing at the 2006 Winter Olympics – Men's moguls|Moguls]]}} {{MedalSilver| [[2010 Winter Olympics|2010 Vancouver]] | [[Freestyle skiing at the 2010 Winter Olympics – Men's moguls|Moguls]]}} {{MedalCompetition| [[FIS Freestyle World Ski Championships]]}} {{MedalGold| [[FIS Freestyle World Ski Championships 2007|2007 Madonna di Campiglio]]|Dual moguls}} {{MedalSilver| [[FIS Freestyle World Ski Championships 2007|2007 Madonna di Campiglio]]|Moguls}} {{MedalBronze| [[FIS Freestyle World Ski Championships 2005|2005 Ruka]]|Moguls}} | show-medals = yes }}
'''Dale Begg-Smith''' {{post-nominals|country=AUS|OAM}} (born 18 January 1985) is an Australian-Canadian businessman and former Olympic [[Freestyle skiing|freestyle skier]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Dale Begg-Smith – The Olympic hero of Australia |url=http://www.olympics30.com/30greatest/dale-begg-smith-iceman-skiing.asp |publisher=Olympic30 |accessdate=23 December 2010}}</ref> Begg-Smith won the [[gold medal]] for Australia in the men's [[Mogul (skiing)|moguls]] event at the [[2006 Winter Olympics]] and silver at the [[2010 Winter Olympics]].
==Early years== Begg-Smith formed an internet company when he was 13 years old.<ref name=":0">{{Cite book|title=The 4-hour work week|last=Ferriss|first=Tim|publisher=Vermilion (London)|year=2011|isbn=9781407023007|location=London|pages=}}</ref> He was skiing for his native Canada as a teenager when his coaches told him he was spending too much time on his successful business and not enough time in training.<ref name=":0" />
So Begg-Smith quit the Canadian ski program and, along with his brother [[Jason Begg-Smith]], moved to Australia at age 16 to live with his cousin Nicole.<ref name="Baum20060217">{{cite news|url=http://www.theage.com.au/news/sport/golden-boy-of-the-slopes/2006/02/16/1140064207497.html|title=Golden boy of the slopes|last=Baum|first=Greg|date=17 February 2006|work=[[The Age]]|accessdate=15 July 2009|location=Melbourne}}</ref> The brothers chose to [[Skiing in Australia|ski for Australia]] because the country had a smaller ski program that offered them more attention and flexibility to successfully manage their business.<ref name=":0" />
The brothers stayed out of competitive skiing for three years and instead trained with the Australian team, living in [[Jindabyne, New South Wales]] each winter. The pair qualified for Australian citizenship, in 2003–04, after three years and were then free to compete for their adopted country.<ref name=":0" />
== Career == Begg-Smith is one of only five Australians to win a gold medal in a Winter Games and the youngest to win an Olympic Gold in the history of men's freestyle mogul skiing.<ref name="Baum20060217" /><ref>{{cite news|title=Ready for the conversion; Bloom sixth as thoughts turn to NFL; Dawson third|last=Hine|first=Tommy|date=16 February 2006|work=[[Hartford Courant]]|location=Hartford, Conn.|page=C.4}}</ref>
In the lead-up to the 2006 Winter Games, Dale Begg-Smith won three World Cup rounds and was ranked world number one in the moguls' discipline.<ref name="SMH20060124">{{cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/sport/dale-begs-the-question-can-australia-win-a-mogul-medal-in-turin/2006/01/23/1137864864166.html|title=Dale begs the question: can Australia win a mogul medal in Turin?|date=24 January 2006|work=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]|accessdate=15 July 2009}}</ref>
Begg-Smith holds the record for qualifying for the most consecutive World Cup finals in events he entered. In March 2010, he reached his 48th consecutive final. His fourth World Cup title in 2010 also put him even with French Skier [[Edgar Grospiron]] for most World Cup wins.<ref name="SMH20100319">{{cite news|url=http://news.smh.com.au/breaking-news-sport/beggsmith-wins-another-world-cup-crown-20100319-qkre.html|title=Begg-Smith wins another World Cup crown|date=19 March 2010|work=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]}}</ref>
Begg-Smith won silver at the [[2010 Winter Olympics]] held in Vancouver, leading to some complaints about biased-judging from members of the Australian coaching staff.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.brisbanetimes.com.au/sport/winter-olympics/australian-dale-beggsmith-settles-for-silver-20100215-o07b.html|title=Dale Begg-Smith Wins Silver Medal|last=Brodie|first=Will|date=15 February 2010|newspaper=Brisbane Times|accessdate=17 February 2010|publisher=Fairfax Digital|author2=Scott Spits|location=|pages=}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/sport/dale-begg-smiths-vancouver-olympics-dream-turns-to-slush/story-e6frg7mf-1225830683994|title=Dale Begg-Smith's Vancouver Olympics dream turns to slush|last=Jeffery|first=Nicole|date=16 February 2010|newspaper=The Australian|accessdate=17 February 2010|publisher=News Limited|location=|pages=}}</ref><ref name="theprovince">{{cite news|url=https://theprovince.com/opinion/Australia+media+dubs+Begg+Smith+Miserable/2568131/Australian+official+accuses+judges+inflating+Canada+score+moguls/2565224/story.html|title=Australian official accuses judges of inflating Canada's score in men's moguls|date=14 February 2010|work=[[The Province]]}}</ref><ref name="SMH_out">{{cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/sport/winter-olympics/dale-cruelly-written-out-of-hosts-fairytale-20100215-o2z9.html|title=Dale cruelly written out of hosts' fairytale|last=Silkstone|first=Dan|date=16 February 2010|work=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]}}</ref><ref name="torontosun">{{cite news|url=http://www.torontosun.com/sports/vancouver2010/news/2010/02/15/12887346.html|title=Aussies claim Bilodeau's gold tainted|date=15 February 2010|work=[[Toronto Sun]]}}</ref> "Sometimes you're in the good graces of the judges, sometimes you're not," Gold medalist [[Alex Bilodeau]] said. "Judged sports can't be perfect. It can be a bad part of my sport. I see it. But everybody is going to be equal in the end." <ref name="torontosun" />
Begg-Smith represented Australia at the 2014 Winter Olympics in Sochi,<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.theage.com.au/sport/winter-olympics/dale-beggsmith-runner-evades-media-at-sochi-airport-20140204-31y4z.html|title=Australian Olympic team management apologise for Dale Begg-Smith runner|work=The Age|location=Melbourne}}</ref> reaching the 2nd qualifying round.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/be/dale-begg-smith-1.html|title=Dale Begg-Smith|website=sports-reference.com|publisher=Sports Reference LLC|accessdate=29 May 2015}}</ref>
== Personal == Begg-Smith is considered a recluse by many, and has repeatedly refused to communicate with non-Australian media, Canadian media in particular.<ref>{{Cite news|last=Jeffery|first=Nicole|title=Dale Begg-Smith's bumpy road to glory|newspaper=The Australian|location=|pages=|publisher=News Limited|date=13 February 2010|url=http://www.theaustralian.com.au/news/sport/dale-begg-smiths-bumpy-road-to-glory/story-fn4vwn8v-1225829865281|accessdate=15 February 2010}}</ref> [[NBC]] dubbed him "the most mysterious man of the Winter Olympics" in a piece aired on 14 February 2010, during the Vancouver games.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.NBC.com/olympics |title=2010 Winter Olympics in Vancouver on NBC(com) – Updated May 18, 2011 5:29 PM |publisher=Nbc.com |date=2011-05-18 |accessdate=2011-06-01}}</ref>
Alisa Monk, coordinator of the moguls program, said that she booked Begg-Smith's hotels and flights economically, despite his wealth. "Wherever the team stays, he stays. There are certainly no big demands. You wouldn't know he had a bit of money." She also said, "When he is at [[Perisher Blue|Perisher]] he stays in the same hut as the other mogul skiers and his brother which is small and old and almost falling down.... He just doesn't try to stand out at all."<ref name="MXMousewhoRoared">MX: "The Mouse who Roared" (Quiet Achiever infobox). 16 February 2006</ref>
After the [[2010 Haiti earthquake]], Begg-Smith donated his prize money – about $13,670 – to earthquake relief efforts in Haiti.<ref>{{cite web|url= http://www.heraldsun.com.au/sport/dale-begg-smiths-media-snow-job/story-e6frf9if-1225828898923|title= Dale Begg-Smith's media snow job|date=18 February 2010|publisher=[[Herald Sun]]}}</ref>
==Business controversy== There are claims that Begg-Smith's internet advertising business, '''Ads CPM''' later called '''CPM Media''', had been linked to the distribution of [[malware]].<ref name="ZDNet">{{cite web|url=http://blogs.zdnet.com/Spyware/?p=786 |title=Australian press on Dale Begg-Smith and spyware |accessdate=20 January 2010 |date=4 March 2006 |publisher=[[ZDNet]] |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100217033150/http://blogs.zdnet.com/Spyware/?p=786 |archivedate=17 February 2010 |df=dmy }}</ref><ref name="CNET">{{cite web|url=http://news.cnet.com/8301-13578_3-10454774-38.html|title=The Olympic skier known as 'spam king'|accessdate=23 February 2010|date=17 February 2010|publisher=[[CNET Networks]]}}</ref> The [[The Sydney Morning Herald|Sydney Morning Herald]] reported that "a trail of digital fingerprints scattered over the web... shows Mr Begg-Smith's long and rewarding involvement in the distribution of "malicious software".<ref name="SMH">{{cite news|url=http://www.smh.com.au/articles/2006/03/03/1141191842651.html|title=Spyware cybersigns point to Begg-Smith|accessdate=20 January 2010|date=4 March 2006|publisher=[[Sydney Morning Herald]]}}</ref> Begg-Smith's manager, David Malina, said reports about his client's business had been "exaggerated", and that "it's not really something that he's involved with anymore ... he's minimised his involvement to concentrate on his sport."<ref name="SMH"/>
==Honours== On 21 February 2006, [[Australia Post]] issued a postage stamp commemorating Begg-Smith's achievement, saying his gold put him in a "small and honoured group of athletes".<ref name="AusPost">[[Australia Post]]: "Australia Post to release Dale Begg-Smith gold medallist stamp". Retrieved 27 March 2006</ref> In 2005, he was awarded [[Ski & Snowboard Australia|Ski and Snowboard Australia's]] Snowsports Athlete of the Year.<ref name="AskMen">{{cite web|url=http://uk.askmen.com/celebs/men/celeb_profiles_sports/8_dale_begg_smith.html|title=Dale Begg-Smith Profile|accessdate=20 January 2010|date=20 March 2010|publisher=[[Ask Men]]}}</ref>
==Results==

[[File:Dalian Hi-tech Zone Administration Bldg.jpg|thumb|right|250px|Dalian Hi-tech Zone Administration Bldg.]]
'''Dalian Hi-tech Zone''' ({{zh|s=大连高新技术产业园区}} or {{zh|s=大连高新区|labels=no}}) or '''DHZ''' is an [[industrial district]] in the western suburb of [[Dalian City]], [[Liaoning Province]], [[China]]. It spreads about 30 kilometers along [[Lushun South Road]] and Guoshui Highway in [[Shahekou District]] and [[Lushunkou District]], where the world's [[high technology]] companies and organizations are situated.
==General Information== The construction of DHZ started in 1991. [[Dalian Software Park]] was added in 1998. The second phase of Dalian Software Park was kicked off in 2003 at the site of Dalian Ascendas IT Park, which officially opened in 2007. DHZ is often called "Lushun South Road Software Industry Belt".<ref>[http://baike.baidu.com/view/2096747.htm Dalian Hi-tech Zone (Baidu Encyclopedia)] (in Chinese)</ref><ref>[http://www.hudong.com/wiki/%E5%A4%A7%E8%BF%9E%E9%AB%98%E6%96%B0%E6%8A%80%E6%9C%AF%E4%BA%A7%E4%B8%9A%E5%9B%AD%E5%8C%BA Dalian Hi-tech Zone (Hudong Encyclopedia)] (in Chinese)</ref>
== IT Parks in Dalian Hi-tech Zone == The whole area of Dalian Hi-tech Zone is under the control of Dalian Hi-tech Industrial Zone Administrative Committee, but all parks therein, except Dalian Hi-tech Zone and Animation Industry Base, written below, are managed by private enterprises. They are from east to west:<ref>[http://www.dlhitech.com/tzcjjIndex.html Investment Promotion Bureau, Dalian Hi-tech Zone Administrative Committee] (in Chinese)</ref>
<center> '''[[Shahekou District]]''' '''Along [[Lushun South Road]]:'''</center>
===Dalian Software Park=== [[File:Dalian-DLSPmodel.jpg|thumb|right|200px|[[Dalian Software Park]] - A 2007 Model]] * Name: [[Dalian Software Park]] ({{zh|labels=no|s=大连软件园}}) <ref>[http://www.dlhitech.com/investment_tzhj03.html?type=1 Dalian Software Park (Investment Promotion Bureau, DHZ)] (in Chinese)</ref> * Established: 1998 * Managed by [[Dalian Software Park (company)|Dalian Software Park Co., Ltd.]], a subsidiary of [[Yida Group]] :Address: No. 1, Digital Square, Dalian, Liaoning, China ({{zh|labels=no|s=大连市数码广场1号}}) * Area Size: 3 km² * No. of companies: 500 :For example, [[Accenture]], [[Genpact]], [[Hewlett-Packard|HP]], [[IBM]] (moving to Dalian Tiandi Software Park), [[Sony]]、[[Panasonic]], [[NEC]], [[Softbank]], [[NEC]], etc.
<gallery> File:Dalian-DLSPnew.jpg|Dalian Software Park </gallery>
===Lingshui Bay General Headquarters=== Now being reclaimed from the [[Yellow Sea]]
===Qixianling Modern Service Industry Area=== * Name: Qixianling Modern Service Industry Nucleus Function Area ({{zh|labels=no|s=七贤岭现代服务业核心功能区}}) <ref>[http://www.dlhitech.com/investment_tzhj02.html?type=1 Qixianling Modern Service Industry Nucleus Function Area (Investment Promotion Bureau, DHZ)] (in Chinese)</ref> :This area is often called "Dalian Hi-tech Zone" in its narrow sense. * Established: 1991 * Managed by: Dalian Hi-tech Industrial Zone Administrative Committee :Address: No. 1, Gaoxin Street, Qixianling Industrial Base, Dalian, Liaoning, China ({{zh|labels=no|s=大连市高新技术产业园七贤岭产业化基地高新街1号}}) * Area Size: 2 km² * No. of companies: 800 :For example, [[Dalian Hi-Think Computer]], [[Citibank]], [[Dell]], [[HiSoft Technology International]], [[NHN Corporation]], etc.
<gallery> File:Dalian Hi-tech Zone Administration Bldg.jpg|Dalian Hi-tech Zone Administration Bldg. </gallery>
===Animation Industry Base=== * Managed by: Dalian Hi-tech Industrial Zone Digital Entertainment Administrative Office * Companies: 110 For example, [[Crystal Digital Technology]] ({{zh|s=水晶石数字科技|labels=no}}), etc.
===Hekou International Software Park=== * Managed by Hekou Village * Companies: [[Yidatec]]
===Dalian Ascendas IT Park=== [[File:Dalian Ascendas IT Park Model.jpg|thumb|right|200px|The Dalian Ascendas IT Park Model. Building No. 1 (right) and Building No. 2 (left) in the back are already open. Building No. 3 in front will be open soon.]] * Name: [[Dalian Ascendas IT Park]] ({{zh|labels=no|s=大连软件园腾飞园区}}) <ref>[http://www.daitp.com/parkoverview_location.html Dalian Ascendas IT Park] (in Chinese)</ref> * Established: 2007 * Managed by DLSP Ascendas Co., Ltd., a joint venture of Ascendas Corp. of Singapore and Dalian Software Park Co., Ltd. :Address: No. 1, Huixianyuan, Dalian Hi-tech Zone, Dalian, Liaoning, China ({{zh|labels=no|s=大连市高新园区汇贤园1号}}) * Area Size: No. 1 Bldg. (100,000 m²) & No. 2 Bldg. (100,000 m²) See [http://www.daitp.com/txt/map.html this guide map]. * No. of companies: 59 :For example, [[CitiBank]], [[Infosys|Infosys Technologies]],<ref>[http://www.infosys.com/newsroom/press-releases/Pages/mou-dalian-high-tech-zone.aspx Infosys China Signs an MoU with Dalian High-tech Zone Government]</ref> [[Konica Minolta]], [[Omron]], etc.
<gallery> File:Dalian Ascendas IT Park 2010.jpg|Dalian Ascendas IT Park </gallery>
===Neusoft Group International Software Park=== * [[Neusoft Group]]
<center> '''[[Lushunkou District]]'''</center>
===Dalian Tiandi Software Park=== [[File:Dalian Tiandi Software Park - Model.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Dalian Tiandi Software Park]] * Name: [[Dalian Tiandi Software Park]] ({{zh|labels=no|s=大连天地软件园}}) <ref>[http://www.dlhitech.com/investment_tzhj06.html?type=1 Dalian Tiandi Software Park (Investment Promotion Bureau, DHZ)] (in Chinese)</ref> * Established: 2010 * Area Size: Jinhuai Building (30,000 m²). See [http://www.daliantiandi.com/ the area map] in Project Introduction (Beware of music!). * Managed by DLSP Shui On Development Co., Ltd., a joint venture of [[Shui On Land]] and Dalian Software Park Co., Ltd. :Address: No. 33, Hongchuan East Rd., Dalian Hi-tech Zone, Dalian, Liaoning, China ({{zh|labels=no|s=大连市高新园区宏川东路33号}}) * No. of Companies: 13 :For example, [[IBM]] (3,000 employees have already moved), [[Kingsoft]], [[Mitsui Real Estate]], etc.
<gallery> File:Dalian Tiandi Software Park 2010.jpg|Dalian Tiandi Software Park </gallery>
===Yingge Software Park=== Under construction
<center> '''Along GuoShui Highway (Guojia - [[Shuishiying]] Villages):'''</center>
===Longtou Technology Park=== Under construction
==Transportation== * Roads: [[China National Highway 201]] (also called [[Lushun South Road]]). 30 minutes by taxi from the hotels on Renming Road, downtown Dalian, to the Dalian Hi-tech Zone Administrative Committee. :City bus: Nos. 3, 10, 28, 531 and other lines :Dalian-Lushun bus: From the north and south exits of Dalian Railway Station * [[Trams in Dalian|Tramway]]: No. 202 line ([[Shahekou Railway Station]] to Xiaopingdao). Being extended via Huangnichuan and [[Longwangtang Cherry Blossom Park|Longwangtang]] to [[Lushun New Port]]. * [[Dalian Subway]]: No. 1 line (under construction) * Railway: 30 minutes by taxi from [[Dalian Railway Station]] * Air: 30 minutes by taxi from [[Dalian Zhoushuizi International Airport]] * Sea: 40 minutes by taxi from [[Dalian Port]]. [[Yacht harbor]]s in [[Xinghai Square]], in front of [[Dalian Maritime University]], and the Xiaopingdao reclaimed area.
<gallery> File:Dalian Railway Station 03.jpg|[[Dalian Railway Station]] File:Dalian Airport.jpg|[[Dalian Zhoushuizi International Airport]] File:Lushun South Road - Xueyuan Square.jpg|[[Lushun South Road]] at Xueyuan Square File:DL6WA.jpg|[[Trams in Dalian]] - No. 202 Line </gallery>
==Education== There are universities and research centers in this area, where about half of [[Dalian#Colleges and universities|all the universities of Dalian]] are located. From east to west are: * [[Dalian Institute of Chemical Physics]] * [[Dalian Fisheries University|Dalian Ocean University]] * [[Dongbei University of Finance and Economics]] :[[Dongbei University of Finance and Economics Press]] * [[Neusoft Institute of Information]] * [[Dalian University of Technology]] :[[Dalian University of Technology Press]] * [[Dalian Maritime University]] * Software and IT Service Training Base of [https://web.archive.org/web/20150627063502/http://www.ambow.com.cn/en/ Ambow Education Group] ({{zh|labels=no|s=安博教育集团}}), Beijing * [[Dalian University of Foreign Languages]] * [[Dalian Medical University]]
<gallery> File:Dalian Institute of Chemical Physics.jpg|[[Dalian Institute of Chemical Physics]] File:Dalian Ocean University.jpg|[[Dalian Fisheries University|Dalian Ocean University]] File:Dongbei University of Finance & Economy.jpg|[[Dongbei University of Finance and Economics]] File:NeusoftInstitute-DalianChina.jpg|[[Neusoft Institute of Information]] File:DUT library.jpg|[[Dalian University of Technology]]'s Library File:Dalian University of Technology - Science Park B Bldg.jpg|[[Dalian University of Technology Press]] File:Dalian Maritime Univ-New Gate.jpg|[[Dalian Maritime University]] File:Dalian Univ of Foreign Languages-Lushun 1.jpg|[[Dalian University of Foreign Languages]] File:Dalian Medical Univ 1.jpg |[[Dalian Medical University]] </gallery>
==Accommodation== * Downtown and [[central business district]] on Renmin Road :[[Shangri-La Hotels and Resorts|Shangri-La]], Furama,<ref>[http://www.furama.com.cn/en/ Furama Hotel Dalian]</ref> [[New World Development|New World]], [[Ramada]], [[Nikko Hotels|Nikko]], [[Kempinski]], Dalian Civil Aviation (Daiwa Royal) <ref>[http://www.daiwahouse.com/English/group/company/dalian01.html Daiwa Royal Hotel]</ref> and other hotels * Dalian World Financial Center at Xinghai Square :[[Howard Johnson's]] hotel * Dalian Hi-tech Zone :Xinbandao Hotel ({{zh|labels=no|s=欣半岛酒店}})
==Living Environment==
===Restaurants=== * Many Chinese restaurants (including Maizi Dawang on Shuma Road) * Western food restaurants (including West Coast coffee shop. There are also [[KFC]], [[McDonald's]] and [[Pizza Hut]] [[fast food|fastfood restaurants]].) * Japanese food restaurants (including Momiji and Kappo Shimizu) * Korean food restaurants (including Kaicheng and Shengdao)
===Cafeterias=== * Cafeterias in major buildings, run by local Dalianite, British and French catering companies
===Apartments=== * More expensive: Residencies at Shangri-La, Furama, Ramada, Nikko, Kempinski and other hotels * Less expensive: International New Village in [[Dalian Software Park]], [[Guigu Jiari]] (Silicon Valley Holiday) on Lushun South Road, etc.
===Shopping=== * [[Hypermarket]]s: [[Dashang Group]]'s Newmart in Heishijiao, [[Walmart]] on Shuma Road, and [[Carrefour]], [[Mykal]] on [[Xi'an Road Commercial Zone]] & [[Qingniwaqiao]] and [[Tesco]] in Heping Square.
===Schools=== In Dalian City, there are: * Kindergartens * Municipal Bilingual School (Chinese/English) * [[Dalian Maple Leaf International School]] (English), Japanese School (at Fujiazhuang) and Korean School (in [[Dalian Development Area]])
===Medical Service=== * No. 2 Hospital, attached to [[Dalian Medical University]]
===Parks, Mountains and Seas=== * [[Xinghai Square]], [[Xinghai Park]], [[Longwangtang Cherry Blossom Park]], etc. <gallery> File:Xinghai Square (Dalian).jpg|[[Xinghai Square]] File:Longwangtang Cherry Blossom Park.JPG|[[Longwangtang Cherry Blossom Park]] </gallery>
== Hi-tech Parks in Other Areas of Dalian == There are other parks, often called the "hi-tech zones" of Dalian.
===Ganjingzi District=== '''Dalian BEST City''' ({{zh|labels=no|s=大连生态科技创新城}}) <ref>[http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/regional/2011-06/18/content_12729582.htm Dalian is building its BEST city (China Daily)]</ref> is located along Lushun North Road.
===Jinzhou District=== New Jinzhou District including [[Dalian Development Area]] has '''[[DD Port]]''' and other hi-tech areas.<ref>[http://english.dda.gov.cn/ Jinzhou New District]</ref>
==See also== *[[List of technology centers]] * [[Dalian Software Park]]
==References== {{reflist}}
== External links == * [http://www.dlhitech.com/ Official site]
[[Category:Dalian]] [[Category:High-technology business districts]]

revision.text:
'''Daniel Křetínský''' is a Czech lawyer and businessman. He is chairman and one of the owners of [[Energetický a průmyslový holding]].<ref>[http://www.epholding.cz/investori/akcionarska-struktura/ Energetický a průmyslový holding, a.s. - Akcionářská struktura]</ref> and co-owner of football club [[AC Sparta Prague]].
His father was Mojmír Křetínský, informatics [[professor]] at [[Masaryk University]],<ref>[https://is.muni.cz/osoba/mojmir?lang=en Masaryk University Information System: prof. RNDr. Mojmír Křetínský, CSc.]</ref><ref name=mot>[http://www.motejlek.com/zazracny-mlady-muz-cekajici-na-skutecne-velky-obchod Motejlek.com: Zázračný mladý muž čekající na skutečně velký obchod]</ref> his mother [[Michaela Židlická]], lawyer and judge of [[Constitutional Court of the Czech Republic|Constitutional Court]].<ref name=mot/>
He graduated from the Faculty of Law of Masaryk University and started to work as legal trainee in [[law firm]]. In 1999, he joined [[J&T]] as lawyer and became a partner in 2003.<ref name=mot/> Since 2004 he is chairman of football club [[AC Sparta Prague]] and he is believed to be its 40% shareholder.<ref>[http://fotbal.idnes.cz/sef-klubu-kretinsky-kupuje-40-procent-akcii-fotbalove-sparty-pl9-/fotbal.aspx?c=A120307_094837_fotbal_rou iDnes.cz: Šéf klubu Křetínský kupuje 40 procent akcií fotbalové Sparty]</ref>
When in 2009 J&T founded Energetický a průmyslový holding, he became its chairman and 20% shareholder.<ref>[http://byznys.ihned.cz/c1-51709130-energeticky-a-prumyslovy-holding-se-chysta-za-dva-roky-na-burzu iHNEd.cz: Energetický a průmyslový holding se chystá za dva roky na burzu]</ref> He also ceased to be partner of J&T. In 2011, he became chairman and 60% shareholder of [[EP Industries]], that was divested from EPH.<ref>[http://www.epholding.cz/en/press/the-ep-industries-group-finalises-its-shareholding-structure/ EPH: The EP Industries Group finalises its shareholding structure]</ref> From 2014 he is one of the owners of Czech media house [[Czech News Center]],<ref>[http://mam.ihned.cz/c1-62111370-kretinsky-a-tkac-prevzali-ringier-prejmenuji-ho-na-czech-news-center Marketing & Media: Křetínský a Tkáč převzali Ringier, přejmenují ho na Czech News Center]</ref> among others publisher of tabloid [[Blesk]], that is the most read newspaper in the Czech Republic.
== References == <references />
